text: National Stadium, Karachi. The National Stadium is a cricket ground in Karachi, Pakistan. The first Test match played at the National Stadium was in 1955 between Pakistan and India. The most recent Test match hosted by the ground, was played in February 2009. The ground has also hosted 46 One Day Internationals (ODIs), the first of these was in 1980 between Pakistan and the West Indies. In cricket, a five-wicket haul (also known as a "five-for" or "fifer") refers to a bowler taking five or more wickets in a single innings. This is regarded as a notable achievement. 48 five-wicket hauls in tests have been taken at the ground. Indian Gulabrai Ramchand took the first such haul on the ground in 1955. Imran Khan's 8/60 in 1982 against India are the best bwoling efforts in an innings. 6 five-wicket hauls in ODIs have been taken at the ground. Waqar Younis took the first such haul on the ground in 1990. Ajantha Mendis's 6/13 in 2008 against India in 2008 Asia Cup are the best bowling efforts in an innings. ==Key== {| class="wikitable" |- !
